intro: Sphaeralcea viridis, commonly known as green globe-mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, round, green fruits that contain seeds. Sphaeralcea viridis is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
